alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 1:33PM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING ABOVE 5500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 5500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8, except 6 to 16 inches west of Highway 395 above 6500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 65 at all elevations on Tuesday, especially outside of the precipitation. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy rain will move into the area Monday evening. Snow will be possible above 6500-7000 feet overnight with initial accumulations of 4 to 10 inches through Tuesday morning. Impacts will be limited to these higher elevations during this time.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
